main event: A 1st Lieutenant observed a silver, semi-transparent spheroid object while working on a B-36 at Carswell Air Force Base on July 6, 1949.
interesting points: The object was reported to be the size of a fist at arm's length,The object flew from south to north at approximately 300 MPH,The observer experienced no associated sound or exhaust trail,Visibility was good with scattered cumulus clouds present,An investigation suggested the object could have been a released rawin balloon due to similarities in description.
witness description: 1st Lieutenant, experienced pilot, working on a B-36 aircraft
